Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend two movies from this list: 'Tora! Tora! Tora!' (1970) and 'Flatliners' (1990).
'Tora! Tora! Tora!' is a classic war movie directed by Nicholas von Staetner. The movie tells the story of the 1941 Japanese air raid on Pearl Harbor, and the series of preceding American blunders that aggrav their effectiveness.
'Flatliners' is a psychological thriller directed by Jerry Schiller. The movie tells the story of five medical students who embark on a daring experiment: by stopping their hearts for short periods, each triggers a near-death experience - giving them a firsthand account of the afterlife.

Based on your preferences, I would recommend "War Horse" and "Dear John".
"War Horse" is a historical drama film based on Michael Morpurgo' novel and adapted for the stage by Nick Stafford. The movie tells the story of a young boy named Albert who lives with his foster parents in rural Devon during World War I. Albert dreams of becoming a soldier himself, and he spends most of his time training to become a solider like his hero, Captain Jack Sparrow from Pirates of the Caribbean.
The movie "War Horse" is directed by Steven Spielberg and stars Jeremy Irons as General John Wilson, Tom Hiddleston as Captain Henry Jackson, Benedict Cumberbatch as Lieutenant Colonel William Miller, David Thewlis as Albert, and Emily Watson as Mrs. Wilson.
"The Gone with the Wind" is a 1936 American epic romance film directed by George Cukor and stars Clark Gable as Scarlett O'Hara, Vivien Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara, Ralph Fiennes as Mr. Dufresne, Lee Pace as Mr. Rhett, Sam Neill as Colonel Rhett, Olivia de Havilland as Minta Scott, Olivia Newton-John as Polly Bennett, and Pam Ferris as Nan SCott.
"The Dear John" is a 2010 American romantic drama film directed by Peter Berg and stars Chris Hemsworth as Jon Snow, Kristen Stewart as Bella Swan, Michael Ironside as Eric Northman, Jeffrey Wright as Aaron Sorkin, Jason Bateman as Jim Stiegler, and Samantha Smart as Samantha Smart.
"Restless" is a 2006 American psychological thriller film directed by David Fincher and stars Mia Wasikowska as Ari, Hayley Atwell as Tiina, Jane Adams as Dr. Carol Goodwin, Rufus Sewell as Dr. Robert Straker, Charlotte Rampling as Dr. Elizabeth Striker
